Event.0: China announces a plan against “foreign garbage” banning 24 categories of plastic and recyclable waste from 2018
Event.1: County singers Blake Shelton and Miranda Lambert divorce after 4 years of marriage
Event.2: American journalist Helen Thomas, who broke through a number of barriers for women reporters and was known especially for her coverage of U.S. presidents, died in Washington, D.C.
Event.3: "Game of Thrones" actress Lena Headey (38) divorces musician Peter Loughran due to irreconcilable differences
Event.4: Joe Petruzzi files for divorce from Annabella Sciorra (Jungle Fever)
Event.5:
Gisele Bündchen
Brazilian model
was born
Event.6: US Viking 1 lands on Mars at Chryse Planitia, 1st Martian landing
Event.7: The Viking 1 lander touched down at Chryse Planitia on Mars.
Event.8: Hank Aaron hits 755th and last home run off Angels Dick Drago
Event.9: "The Exorcist" writer William Peter Blatty (47) weds tennis player Linda Tuero (24) in Las Vegas
Event.10: Apollo 11 lunar module carrying Neil Armstrong, Buzz Aldrin and Michael Collins lands on the surface of the Moon; Aldrin and Armstrong walk on the moon seven hours later
Event.11:
First Moon landing
On this day in 1969, the Eagle lunar landing module, carrying U.S. astronauts Neil Armstrong and Edwin (“Buzz”) Aldrin, landed on the Moon, and several hours later Armstrong became the first person to set foot on its surface.
Event.12:
Enrique Peña Nieto
president of Mexico
was born
Event.13: Armistice for Indo-China signed, Vietnam separates into North and South
Event.14: "Arthur Murray Party" premieres on ABC TV (later DuMont, CBS, NBC)
Event.15:
Carlos Santana
American musician
was born
Event.16: During World War II, German military leaders attempted to assassinate Adolf Hitler in the July Plot.
Event.17: Billboard publishes its 1st singles record chart (#1 is "I'll Never Smile Again" by Tommy Dorsey)
Event.18:
Natalie Wood
American actress
was born
Event.19:
Cormac McCarthy
American author
was born
Event.20: Congresswoman Alice Mary Robertson becomes the first woman to preside over the floor of US House of Representatives
Event.21: Prince Georgy Yevgenyevich Lvov resigned his post as prime minister of Russia's Provisional Government following the July Days demonstrations.
Event.22: The Corfu Declaration was issued, calling for the establishment of a unified Yugoslav state following World War I.
Event.23: The Pullman Strike, a widespread railroad strike in the United States, ended shortly after President Grover Cleveland ordered federal troops to Chicago.
Event.24: Sioux Indian Chief Sitting Bull, surrenders to US federal troops
Event.25: The Siege of Pleven began in the Russo-Turkish War of 1877–78.
Event.26: Inventor Karl Benz (27) weds Bertha Ringer
Event.27: Reynier van Oldenbarnevelt marries Anna Weytzen in Delft
Event.28: The forces of the Ottoman sultan Bayezid I were defeated by those of the Central Asian ruler Timur in the Battle of Ankara, resulting in the collapse of Bayezid's empire.
